goal: S1 Average under 29.0s and consistency under 1.5s σ

preferences: Responds well to having feelings validated by data

session_history.focus_area: Sector 1 (Entry Phase) - 1.61s loss per lap, highest variance
session_history.notes: First session of Season 01 2026. Track completely new. Technical, karting-like. No white lines for reference except center dotted lines. Tricky last corner and esses section. S2 is already solid (0.55s loss). S1 and S3 are the big opportunities.

session_history.focus_area: Sector 1 (Entry Phase) - 0.61s loss per lap, σ = 0.66s
session_history.notes: Second session of the day (3 hours after first). Paradox session: Objectively faster (0.3s improvement) and WAY more consistent (6x improvement in σ), but Master Lonn felt 'all over the place' and 'no feel'. Classic overdriving symptom. S2 is locked in (0.28s loss, σ = 0.19s). Key insight: Can't brute-force feel. Need to dial back to 95% and build rhythm first. The disconnect between objective improvement and subjective feeling is strong.

insights: Master Lonn is new to Summit Point Jefferson
Track positioning is challenging without clear white lines
Using center dotted lines as reference points
Eager to learn and improve pace
Asks the right questions about improvement
Sector 2 is LOCKED IN - found the rhythm there (σ = 0.19s)
Biggest opportunities are in S1 (entry) and S3 (exit)
CRITICAL INSIGHT: Master Lonn experiences 'feel disconnect' when overdriving - lap times improve but confidence tanks
Pushing harder doesn't always equal better results for ADHD drivers - need rhythm and reference points
When S1 is messy, S3 suffers (cascade effect)
Master Lonn's brain needs the mental model to match physical execution or it feels chaotic
next_steps: STOP chasing lap time, START chasing rhythm
Dial back to 95% effort in S1 to find the FEEL
Pick ONE braking point, ONE turn-in, ONE throttle point - repeat 5 laps identically
Target: S1 average under 28.5s with σ under 0.5s
Goal: 5 consecutive laps where S1 is within 0.2s of each other
Use S2 feeling (which is locked in) as reference for how S1 should feel
After rhythm is established at 95%, THEN push for lap time
